verses.text: Moses assembled all the congregation of the Israelites and said to them, "These are the words that the LORD has commanded you to do:
verses.comment: Faithful rendering of original narrative; 'Israelites' for 'children of Israel' per modern usage.

verses.text: Six days work shall be done, but on the seventh day there shall be holiness for you, a sabbath of complete rest to the LORD. Whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
verses.comment: Translation mirrors language about Sabbath and punishment.

verses.text: You shall not kindle a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath day."
verses.comment: Accurately reflects specific command about fire.

verses.text: Moses said to all the congregation of the Israelites, "This is the thing which the LORD has commanded:
verses.comment: Continues narrative faithfully.

verses.text: 'Take from among you an offering to the LORD. Everyone whose heart moves him, let him bring the LORD's offering: gold, silver, and bronze;
verses.comment: 'Heart moves him' echoes Hebrew; captures voluntary nature of the offering.

verses.text: blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, fine linen, goats' hair,
verses.comment: Stays close to original listing of materials.

verses.text: ram skins dyed red, badger skins, and acacia wood,
verses.comment: "Badger skins"—precise animal uncertain; retained traditional rendering.

verses.text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
verses.comment: Aligns with material list in 25:6.

verses.text: onyx stones and stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastplate.
verses.comment: Preserves details about priestly garments.

verses.text: "Let every craftsman among you come and make all that the LORD has commanded:
verses.comment: "Craftsman" for skilled worker; close to Hebrew.

verses.text: the tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its hooks, frames, bars, pillars, and bases;
verses.comment: Direct listing of items as in Hebrew.

verses.text: the ark and its poles, the mercy seat, and the veil of the screen;
verses.comment: Standard terms preserved for accurate theology.

verses.text: the table and its poles and all its utensils, and the bread of the Presence;
verses.comment: "Bread of the Presence" conveys literal 'showbread.'

verses.text: the lampstand also for the light, its utensils and its lamps, and the oil for the light;
verses.comment: "Lampstand" for 'menorah' in familiar English.

verses.text: and the altar of incense with its poles, and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the screen for the entrance, at the entrance of the tabernacle;
verses.comment: Retains item order and wording.

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering with its bronze grating, its poles, and all its utensils, the basin and its stand;
verses.comment: "Burnt offering" properly names the altar.

verses.text: the hangings of the court, its pillars and its bases, and the screen for the gate of the court;
verses.comment: Details of tabernacle courtyard preserved.

verses.text: the pegs of the tabernacle and the pegs of the court, and their cords;
verses.comment: Literal translation, 'pegs' used.

verses.text: the finely woven garments for ministering in the Holy Place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments for his sons to serve as priests."
verses.comment: Maintains focus on priesthood.

verses.text: Then all the congregation of the Israelites departed from before Moses.
verses.comment: Literal departure described.

verses.text: They came, everyone whose heart stirred him, and everyone whose spirit prompted him, and brought the LORD's offering to be used for the work of the Tent of Meeting, and for all its service, and for the holy garments.
verses.comment: "Heart stirred" mirrors the original; 'Tent of Meeting' for tabernacle.

verses.text: So they came, both men and women, all who were willing-hearted, brought brooches, earrings, signet rings, armlets—all kinds of gold objects—every man presenting an offering of gold to the LORD.
verses.comment: No change to gender pronouns; 'willing-hearted' is literal to Hebrew.

verses.text: And everyone who had blue, purple, or scarlet yarn, fine linen, goats' hair, ram skins dyed red, or badger skins, brought them.
verses.comment: List of materials closely follows wording above.

verses.text: Everyone who could make a contribution of silver or bronze brought it as the LORD's offering. And everyone who possessed acacia wood of any use for the work brought it.
verses.comment: Direct translation; 'acacia wood' retained as in original.

verses.text: And every skillful woman spun with her hands, and they brought what they had spun: blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and fine linen.
verses.comment: Explicit that the spinners were women, as in the original.

verses.text: And all the women whose hearts prompted them in wisdom spun the goats' hair.
verses.comment: Retains 'in wisdom' (skillfulness), and identifies active participants.

verses.text: The leaders brought onyx stones and stones to be set, for the ephod and for the breastplate,
verses.comment: 'Leaders' for 'rulers'—accurate.

verses.text: and spices and oil for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
verses.comment: Faithful translation.

verses.text: All the men and women, the Israelites, whose heart moved them to bring anything for the work that the LORD had commanded by Moses to be done, brought it as a freewill offering to the LORD.
verses.comment: Freewill gift emphasized, as in Hebrew.

verses.text: Then Moses said to the Israelites, "See, the LORD has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
verses.comment: Bezalel's ancestry and tribe specified.

verses.text: And he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, and with knowledge, and with all kinds of craftsmanship,
verses.comment: Key terms: God's Spirit, wisdom, understanding, knowledge.

verses.text: to devise artistic designs, to work in gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.comment: Closely follows Hebrew mapping of skills.

verses.text: and in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, to work in every skillful craft.
verses.comment: Skillful craftsmanship language preserved.

verses.text: And he has inspired him to teach, both him and Oholiab the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
verses.comment: 'Inspired him to teach' reflects the Hebrew 'put in his heart to teach.'

verses.text: He has filled them with skill of heart to do every kind of work: of the engraver, the designer, the embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen, and the weaver—those who do every kind of work and those who devise artistic designs.
verses.comment: 'Skill of heart' renders the Hebrew 'chochmat-lev'; all art forms included as in the original.
